summary: This is an internal email chain from July 6-7, 2019, among U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) staff discussing press strategy and media activity related to Jeffrey Epstein. The emails indicate reporters have obtained information and are waiting for Monday, and the office is coordinating on whether to notify the Office of Public Affairs (OPA) about any statements.

events.title: Internal SDNY email discussion on Epstein press strategy
events.description: SDNY staff exchange emails coordinating press strategy and media notifications regarding Jeffrey Epstein, discussing whether to alert the Office of Public Affairs about potential statements.

events.title: Observation of quieting phone activity from reporters
events.description: A Chief Public Information Officer notes that phone activity from reporters has quieted down, suggesting they obtained needed information and are waiting until Monday.

keyFacts: Internal SDNY emails from July 6-7, 2019 discuss press strategy related to Jeffrey Epstein.
Reporters had obtained information from an unspecified source and were waiting until Monday for further developments.
SDNY staff were coordinating on whether to notify the Office of Public Affairs (OPA) about any press statements regarding Epstein.
The document shows the U.S. Attorney's Office was actively managing media relations during the Epstein investigation in July 2019.
